fields.value: CBS News State of the Union Poll, January 2000

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This special topic poll, fielded January 21-23, 2000, is  part of a continuing series of monthly surveys that solicit public  opinion on the presidency and on a range of other political and social  issues. The focus of this data collection was on the political  atmosphere in the United States prior to President Bill Clinton's  January 27, 2001, State of the Union address. Respondents were asked  to give their opinions of President Clinton and his handling of the  presidency, as well as their views of Vice President Al Gore and the  United States Congress. Respondents were also asked to specify which  of the following issues was most important for the government to  address: the budget deficit, education, health care, Medicare, Social  Security, or taxes. A series of questions addressed the upcoming  November 7, 2000, presidential election, including whether the  respondent's vote should be considered a vote in support of or against  Clinton's policies, what leadership style the next president should  employ, and whether the respondent would vote for the Democratic or  Republican candidate, if the election were held that day. An  additional question sought res
pondents' views on whether Elian  Gonzalez, the Cuban boy who was found off the Florida coast after  escaping Cuba, should remain in the United States with relatives or  return to live with his father in Cuba. Background information on  respondents includes age, gender, political party, political  orientation, voter registration and participation history, race, Hispanic origin, and marital status.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

fields.value: Version Date: 2001-03-15Version Text: 2001-03-15Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) This collection has not been processed by ICPSR  staff. ICPSR is distributing the data and documentation for this  collection in essentially the same form in which they were  received. When appropriate, documentation has been converted to  Portable Document Format (PDF), data files have been converted to  non-platform-specific formats, and variables have been recoded to  ensure respondents' anonymity. (2) The codebook is provided by ICPSR  as a Portable Document Format (PDF) file. The PDF file format was  developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF  reader software, such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how  to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided on the ICPSR Web site.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;
